DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Microsatellite Stability Assessment Mismatch Repair Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator related to the outcome of Microsatellite Stability Assessment Mismatch Repair as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Microsatellite Stability Assessment Mismatch Repair Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._An assessment of the variability in length of an individual's microsatellite sequences; microsatellite length instability may be due to mismatch repair protein mutation._The mismatch repair (MMR) system promotes genomic fidelity by repairing base-base mismatches, insertion-deletion loops and heterologies generated during DNA replication and recombination. This function is critically dependent on the assembly of multimeric complexes involved in mismatch recognition and signal transduction to downstream repair events._The result of an action._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Microsatellite Stability Assessment Mismatch Repair Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An assessment of the variability in length of an individual's microsatellite sequences; microsatellite length instability may be due to mismatch repair protein mutation.:The mismatch repair (MMR) system promotes genomic fidelity by repairing base-base mismatches, insertion-deletion loops and heterologies generated during DNA replication and recombination. This function is critically dependent on the assembly of multimeric complexes involved in mismatch recognition and signal transduction to downstream repair events.:The result of an action.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An assessment of the variability in length of an individual's microsatellite sequences; microsatellite length instability may be due to mismatch repair protein mutation.

The mismatch repair (MMR) system promotes genomic fidelity by repairing base-base mismatches, insertion-deletion loops and heterologies generated during DNA replication and recombination. This function is critically dependent on the assembly of multimeric complexes involved in mismatch recognition and signal transduction to downstream repair events.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
